title: Was the Native American woman who went to Iceland (Possibly more than one) kidnapped or did she marry a Viking out of her own free will? Apparently she arrived in Iceland pregnant & a few Norse trace their ancestry to her. Was this voluntary? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Was the Native American woman who went to Iceland (Possibly more than one) kidnapped or did she marry a Viking out of her own free will? Apparently she arrived in Iceland pregnant & a few Norse trace their ancestry to her. Was this voluntary?” The theory that Icelanders may have medieval Native American ancestry is very new and is still not well proven or widely accepted. Even if it does become accepted, it will probably be impossible to know the exact circumstances regarding how that happened, barring some unknown documents being discovered at some point.

There is a story in one of the sagas about the Norse in Vinland and two indigenous children (one girl, one boy) who were captured by the Norse and taken back with them to Iceland, taught Old Norse-Icelandic, and Christianized (sorry, can’t remember which saga this was). No one can know for certain: 1) whether this was historically accurate; or 2) whether these two, or one of them, survived and became the ultimate source of the reported Native American DNA in Iceland.
